pr_title: Test public api usage in integration tests

timeline.message: add public API usage in servlet test app
use broad app package to cover all test apps

timeline.bodyText: just out of curiosity: why would co.elastic.webapp not work?
timeline.author: felixbarny
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -154,6 +154,7 @@ protected AbstractServletContainerIntegrationTest(GenericContainer<?> servletCon
             .withEnv("ELASTIC_APM_TRACE_METHODS", "public @@javax.enterprise.context.NormalScope co.elastic.*")
             .withEnv("ELASTIC_APM_DISABLED_INSTRUMENTATIONS", "") // enable all instrumentations for integration tests
             .withEnv("ELASTIC_APM_PROFILING_SPANS_ENABLED", "true")
+            .withEnv("ELASTIC_APM_APPLICATION_PACKAGES", "co.elastic") // allows to use API annotations, we have to use a broad package due to multiple apps

replies.bodyText:
Other applications were in other sub-packages, for example co.elastic.apm.spring.boot or co.elastic.apm.soap, and setting it to the webapp sub-package breaks the soap test application as it makes soap transactions ignored (co.elastic.apm.soap.HelloWorldServiceImpl is annotated with @javax.jws.WebService).
There is a small difference here when the application_packages is not set, the @javax.jws.WebService is properly instrumented, whereas methods annotated with @co.elastic.apm.api.CaptureSpan are not.
I think it might be worth making it consistent and make @CaptureSpan and other annotations instrumentation work by default (even if it makes things slower), but that should be fixed in another PR.
replies.author: SylvainJuge
